page.title: 05FARMING REPORT IN BOLTON
page.content: Mr Roberts, his wife and 2 children, farming at Bank House farm for the past 14 years, have worked hard to improve the standard of their 100 acres of grazing land. Previously the land was used as an open cast mining site and when the top soil was replaced it was not entirely suitable. Now the quality of their grass is good enough to enable cows to produce good milk and calves to be reared successfully. The farm has 150 cows but no bulls; artificial insemination is used instead.Farmers cannot allow themselves to become attached to new calves as all males are sold at 12 months. Mr R. works 7 days a week without holidays but feels that working in the countryside is worth the disadvantages. His greatest dread is that the coal board will reclaim his land but he remains optimistic.
